Create required build directories if they do not exist yet

scripts.compile.functions.deal_with_user_input(args__cmd_line: Namespace) → Namespace¶

Manage user arguments passed through the command line, and collect missing ones through the input() command. Additionally, perform tests for availability, quit commands and index inputs.

Parameters:

args__cmd_line (argparse.Namespace) – user passed arguments through the command line

Returns:

Validated and updated arguments

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

scripts.compile.proccesses module¶

scripts.compile.proccesses.trigger_biber(thing_name: str, latex_doc_name: str, printout: bool = True) → None¶

Trigger biber

Parameters:

  • thing_name (str) – name of document to compile.

  • latex_doc_name (str) – filename of document’s main tex file.

  • printout (bool, optional) – Whether to print log to console or not. Defaults to True.

scripts.compile.proccesses.trigger_lualatex(thing_name: str, latex_doc_name: str, printout: bool = True) → None¶

Trigger biblatex compilation

Parameters:

  • thing_name (str) – name of document to compile.

  • latex_doc_name (str) – filename of document’s main tex file.

  • printout (bool, optional) – Whether to print log to console or not. Defaults to True.

scripts.compile.watch module¶

class scripts.compile.watch.MyHandler(trigger_function, trigger_args, file_types, paths_to_ignore)¶

Bases: FileSystemEventHandler

Class to handle events: creation of new files or modification/deletion of existing ones

Parameters:

FileSystemEventHandler (_type_) – _description_

on_created(event)¶

Called when a file or directory is created.

Parameters:

event (DirCreatedEvent or FileCreatedEvent) – Event representing file/directory creation.

on_deleted(event)¶

Called when a file or directory is deleted.

Parameters:

event (DirDeletedEvent or FileDeletedEvent) – Event representing file/directory deletion.

on_generic(event, task: str) → None¶
on_modified(event)¶

Called when a file or directory is modified.

Parameters:

event (DirModifiedEvent or FileModifiedEvent) – Event representing file/directory modification.

scripts.compile.watch.slow_type(text: str, frequency_sec: int) → None¶

Gradually print out a string in the console

Parameters:

  • text (str) – string to print to console

  • frequency_sec (int) – speed in seconds that the whole string takes to print

scripts.compile.watch.watcher(function_to_trigger: Callable, function_arguments: Namespace, path_to_watch: str, file_types: tuple[str, ...], paths_to_ignore: list[str], frequency_sec: int) → None¶

watcher to detect creation of new files, or deletion/changes of existing ones, and trigger a desired behavior.

Parameters:

  • function_to_trigger (function) – function to trigger on changes

  • function_arguments (argparse.Namespace) – arguments that are passed to the function

  • path_to_watch (str) – path to watch recursively

  • file_types (tuple[str, ...]) – tuple of file types to watch, to the exclusion of others

  • paths_to_ignore (list[str]) – list of paths to be ignored by watcher, be them files on folders

  • frequency_sec (int) – frequency at which the watcher is triggered
